    • Method Detail

      • setupDirs

        private void setupDirs()
                throws IOException
        Creates multiple directories for testing. Contents of them are dir:tmp: file: x dir:del: file: x dir: dir1 : file:x dir: dir2 : file:x link: y to tmp/x link: tmpDir to tmp dir:partitioned: file: part-r-00000, contents: "foo" file: part-r-00001, contents: "bar"
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createFile

        private File createFile(File directory,
              String name,
              String contents)
                 throws IOException
        Creates a new file in the specified directory, with the specified name and the specified file contents. This method will add a newline terminator to the end of the contents string in the destination file.
        Parameters:
        directory - File non-null destination directory.
        name - String non-null file name.
        contents - String non-null file contents.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • testFullyDeleteSymlinks

        public void testFullyDeleteSymlinks()
                             throws IOException
        Tests if fullyDelete deletes (a) symlink to file only and not the file pointed to by symlink. (b) symlink to dir only and not the dir pointed to by symlink.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • validateTmpDir

      • setupDirsAndNonWritablePermissions

        private void setupDirsAndNonWritablePermissions()
                                         throws IOException
        Creates a directory which can not be deleted completely. Directory structure. The naming is important in that TestFileUtil.MyFile is used to return them in alphabetical order when listed. del(+w) | .---------------------------------------, | | | | file1(!w) xSubDir(-rwx) ySubDir(+w) zlink | | | | file2(-rwx) file3 | xSubSubDir(-rwx) | file22(-rwx)
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyMerge

        private boolean copyMerge(String src,
                String dst)
                   throws IOException
        Calls FileUtil.copyMerge using the specified source and destination paths. Both source and destination are assumed to be on the local file system. The call will not delete source on completion and will not add an additional string between files.
        Parameters:
        src - String non-null source path.
        dst - String non-null destination path.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the call to FileUtil.copyMerge was successful.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • testGetDU

        public void testGetDU()
               throws Exception
        Test that getDU is able to handle cycles caused due to symbolic links and that directory sizes are not added to the final calculated size
        Throws:
        IOException
        Exception
